Sentencas: We present density-functional theory calculations of the chemisorption of atomic species O, S, C, H and reaction intermediates OH, SH, and CHn (n = 1, 2, and 3) on M/Ni alloy model catalysts (M = Bi, Mo, Fe, Co, and Cu).
Titulo: Catalytic activity of bimetallic nickel alloys for solid-oxide fuel cell anode reactions from density-functional theory

Sentencas: The activity of the Ni alloy catalysts for solid-oxide fuel cell (SOFC) anode oxidation reactions is predicted, based on a simple descriptor, i.e., the binding energy of oxygen.
Titulo: Catalytic activity of bimetallic nickel alloys for solid-oxide fuel cell anode reactions from density-functional theory

Sentencas: First, we find that the binding of undesirable intermediates, such as C and S. can be inhibited and the catalytic activity of planar Ni-based anodes can be tuned towards oxidation by selectively forming a bimetallic surface alloy.
Titulo: Catalytic activity of bimetallic nickel alloys for solid-oxide fuel cell anode reactions from density-functional theory

Sentencas: In particular, Cu/Ni, Fe/Ni, and Co/Ni anode catalysts are found to be most active towards anode oxidation.
Titulo: Catalytic activity of bimetallic nickel alloys for solid-oxide fuel cell anode reactions from density-functional theory

Sentencas: On the other hand, the Mo/Ni alloy surface is predicted to be the most effective catalyst in terms of inhibiting the deposition of C and S (while still preserving relatively high catalytic activity).
Titulo: Catalytic activity of bimetallic nickel alloys for solid-oxide fuel cell anode reactions from density-functional theory

Sentencas: The formation of a surface alloy, which has the alloy element enriched on the topmost surface, was found to be critical to the activity of the Ni alloy catalysts.
Titulo: Catalytic activity of bimetallic nickel alloys for solid-oxide fuel cell anode reactions from density-functional theory
Catalytic activity of bimetallic nickel alloys for solid-oxide fuel cell anode reactions from density-functional theory
